repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Social Service Delivery Project :
            INT redacted report

abstracts.cdata!:
The International Development
            Association (IDA) and Albania signed a development credit
            agreement for the Social Services Delivery Project for
            approximately United States (U.S.) 12 million dollars. This
            report provides the findings of an administrative inquiry by
            the World Bank Group (WBG) Integrity Vice Presidency (INT)
            into allegations that Company A may have engaged in
            misconduct in connection with the project in the Republic of
            Albania. The purpose of the investigation was to allow the
            WBG to determine if the WBG’s framework regarding
            anti-corruption has been violated. Company A submitted its
            bid for the contract. The bid contained several
            manufacturer’s authorization forms (MAFs), including one
            that purportedly was issued by Company B. Evidence suggests
            that Company B informed the project implementing unit (PIU)
            that it had not issued the MAF to Company A. Upon the PIU’s
            request to extend the bid validity for the third time,
            Company A replied that it will not proceed with the third
            extension of the bid validity and respective bid security
            validity. Thus, Company A’s bid was not considered for
            further evaluation.

Albania - Social Service Delivery Project :

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Services Delivery
            Project for Albania were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            moderate; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: Political economy may dictate that
            project design has multiple layers and complexities even
            when institutional capacities are not at par. When entering
            a sector where the Borrower has little experience and
            knowledge, it is helpful to provide support for policy
            development and use it as a platform to jumpstart an
            in-country policy dialogue and build consensus around a
            legal framework. Institutional change takes a long time yet
            with ample implementation support and time, it yields
            long-lasting results. Monitoring indicators and a system for
            data collection and evaluation need to be clearly
            established at the beginning of the project to evaluate
            project implementation and the achievement of project
            objectives. Building local procurement and financial
            management capacity right at the beginning of the project is
            crucial for smooth implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Social Services Delivery Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Services Delivery Project for
            Albania aims to improve standards of living for the poor and
            vulnerable population groups by increasing their access to
            well-targeted and effective social care services; assisting
            the Government to develop, monitor, and evaluate more
            effective social policy; and improving capacity for
            planning, managing, and delivering social care services with
            increased involvement of local governments, communities, and
            civil society. The six-month extension of the closing date,
            will enable the completion of all remaining activities, help
            ensure disbursement of remaining funds, and allow for
            successful achievement of the project development objective
            (PDO). It will also help to ensure sustainability of
            investments completed so far since the Government, due to
            the current fiscal constraints, may not be able to support
            the remaining investments from the state budget. There are
            no proposed changes to the PDO or results framework. The
            project's financial management is currently rated
            satisfactory, reflecting overall appropriate financial
            management arrangements and adoption of all previous
            recommendations for further system strengthening. There are
            no outstanding audit reports for the project and the last
            one presented an unqualified opinion.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Social Services
            Delivery Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Helping families and children with special
            needs in Albania

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about helping
            families and children with special needs in Albania. There
            were no programs to support the children with learning
            disabilities in the country. Social Services Delivery
            Project renovated the school building and equipped rooms for
            the special needs children. Thirteen residential care
            services centers in eight different cities in the country
            had been assisted by the project and over 25,000 people with
            special needs had been benefited. In addition to helping day
            care centers, the project had also supported the drafting of
            a new social services law. Strengthening the legislative
            framework assisted those at the margins of Albanian society.

docna.cdata!:
Helping families and children with special
            needs in Albania

display_title.display_title:
Helping families and children
            with special needs in Albania
